Reviews.Content: This place is running down. Avoid it! We have stay in this hotel 2 years ago and didn鈥檛 hesitate to take it again. But it seems that hotel has changed an owner and running down. We got a smoking room instead of non-smoking (on reception that call it non-smoking, but is smell ugly and even have sign on the door 鈥溾€his room may contains chemicals include tobacco smoke 鈥︹€?鈥?so they probably just removed ashtrays to turn room to 鈥渘on-smoking鈥?. They refused to give us other room. When we arrived, all windows in the room were opened (probably to reduce smell but without success) and it was really cold, so we tried to use air conditioner as a heater. But it was so noisy that we can鈥檛 sleep; so we turn it off and use our clothes for keep us warm through the night. Carpet in the room was very dirty. There was no heater in bathroom, so it was cold. There was no refrigerator and microware in the room that is unusual for Travelodge hotels. We were charged additional $14 per day for parking, but even so you should look for a free spot for a long time in 3 hotel parking lots, that next door restaurant uses as well. But the worst thing was smell in the room 鈥?my wife got allergy and just now, after a week, is recovering from it. I have stayed in few Travelodge hotels before, and I can say that this one doesn鈥檛 correspond to Travelodge standards 鈥?actually, to any standard. I have newer had such bad stay before, even in chip motels. And we paid more then $100 per night.
Reviews.Author: TouristToronto

Reviews.Content: Cheap, Clean, Convenient Travelodge by the Bay was a perfect choice for our 4 day getaway to San Francisco. The price was good, the room was big and clean and it is a great location. Literally across the street from hotels twice the price. It takes about 10-15 minutes to walk to the Pier, and is very close to the Lombard Cable Car stop. The staff were friendly and helpful. Only complaints are that the room was a bit drafty and the towels were terrible! Almost like a loofah on your skin. No big deal.Excellent choice if you are not expecting luxury.
Reviews.Author: HappyAlbertan

Reviews.Content: Cheap accomodation We stayed 3 days at the Travelodge. It has a good location and not too far to walk to Pier 39  Fisherman's Wharf. It is a budget accomodation so don't expect 5 star. But if you only want a bed to sleep in  plan on being out  about all day, this is the place for you. It's clean  tidy  the bed was comfortable.
Reviews.Author: OutbackAussie

Reviews.Content: Could provide us parking when no one else could We found this motel when we had no other place to turn. First and foremost , if you've never been to SanFransico before BE WARNED, PARKING IS AN ABSOLUTE PREMIUM!!!!!!! We were booked in at the Ramada just down the street. Arrived about two O clock in the afternoon and they could not porovide us with a parking spot(Only a dozen spots for probably over 50 ROOMS!!!)We explained to the desk clerk that we would not stay unless he could provide a spot for our vehicle. No luck! So we cancelled our reservation, and found the travelodge who for a small cost could provide us with a spot to park. We found it to be more than adeqaute for our needs, clean comfortable and we felt safe. Location was good also. There is a small diner about two doors down the street which was has very good food and good service.
Reviews.Author: curtsmom

Reviews.Content: Medicocre experience We arrived late and got the last parking spot which was very tight and hard to get in and out of. We checked in and our room was ok. It's one of those rooms that you can't really find anything wrong with but you just don't feel quite comfortable. At bedtime we could not sleep because the walls are paper thin and the guy beside us was snoring sooo loud we felt like he was in bed with us. We tried sleeping the opposite way on the bed, but no luck, so eventually we had to call front desk and switch rooms. (I have never done this before!) They gave us a way nicer, cleaner, quieter room the second time. It was fine, and if my original experience was the second room I would have a lot more nice things to say. It wasn't fun carting suitcases at 11:30pm.. but oh well. The next day we were able to walk to most of the famous downtown sites from our hotel. Walking distance to the Crookedest Street, Pier and cable cars. I guess we paid more for location.. because I wouldn't say it was a $100 room!
Reviews.Author: zoodles23

Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for! I stayed here with my family - husband and two children. Bad first impressions of the place as the guy on reception who checked us in was unfriendly and didn't even smile (and this was our experience of him whenever we spoke with him during our 4 night stay - though we also saw three other members of the reception staff and they weren't much better!). We had to pay for parking although it wasn't stated on the website that parking wasn't free! Our room was large but the decor looked tired and dated. The bathroom was tiny. One of the electrical sockets, at floor level, was broken and prime for young children to put their fingers into.Breakfast was available but wasn't great - various pastries which my normally pastry loving kids thought were awful. One day I went to get juices for my children for breakfast and was told they'd run out the previous night but there was tea or coffee for them. Not the ideal drinks for children! However juice was found a few minutes later.Cleanliness in the rooms wasn't too bad but the walkways and stairs around the hotel were dirty.It wasn't until we checked out that we saw a friendly face on reception, a lady who I think possibly could be in charge and she was very friendly and helpful, it's a shame the rest of her staff aren't the same.I'm giving it 2/5 because I'm factoring in the location, it wasn't too far to walk to the Fisherman's Wharf area.
Reviews.Author: SparklySilver

Reviews.Content: Great Location Welllll....everyone's is right about the location. Excellent. It looked like there was a construction crew staying at the hotel and they were kinda loud and unruly.Guess we're a little spoiled. We weren't too impressed with the accommodations and our room smelled kinda musty. We moved to a Hilton in Downtown.It's all a matter of personal taste and comfort.The staff was very nice and helpful.
Reviews.Author: Genevax

Reviews.Content: great place to stay if on a tight budget Stayed here with a group of friends for 1 night on the way back down from Lake Tahoe. The hotel staff were very accomodating in letting us book into a room earlier and dropping our bags off. We also managed to get rooms at the back which meant we were spared any road side noise in the evening. The location of the motel is superb. Basically follow highway 101(north) off Van Ness and on to Lombard St. It sits just at the beginning of Lombard St. The rooms were large, clean and comfy and fealt safe. The location as regards sightseeing is perfect. Not too far away from anything and for the price we paid, superb value. All in, well worth the stay, and would definatley use it again.
Reviews.Author: Roy Little

Reviews.Content: Nice location/decor/price Just got home from 5 night trip to SF. The Travelodge By The Bay is in a good location! 10 minute walk to the wharf! Nice rooms-bathrooms. Mine just had a shower-but who wants to bathe in a hotel tub anyways. Room was clean and updated. Seemed like a safe neighborhood. Motel staff was great about taking care of loud people above us one night! I would recomend this motel to anyone on a budget who can walk a few blocks to wharf or cabele cars....closest you can get without being at the wharf (which will cost you)
Reviews.Author: butterflygirl0624

Reviews.Content: Highly Recommend We stayed at the Travelodge for 4 nights in Feb. The rooms were clean and the staff was very friendly and accomodating. We also felt it was in a very safe area. We walked home from the wharf in the evening and felt very safe. The wharf is a little bit of a walk, maybe 7 blocks or so, but the price was definatley worth the extra walk. Would stay here again.
Reviews.Author: Goddesslily

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel for a good price       Room
Reviews.Author: wompipompi

Reviews.Content: ok for the price Stayed at the travelodge-by-the-bay for 3 nights on our American/Honeymoon tour .On a major road so a little noisy at times.Great location , about 5 blocks from the fishermans wharf.Very hilly so you need to be quite fit.Nice clean hotel ,rooms cleaned /changed everyday.Reception very helpfulWould stay here again
Reviews.Author: DaveG130

Reviews.Content: thin walls For the dates we wanted for $200 and location close to fishermans wharf we ended up here..The walls are made of thin cardboard. Every time someone slammed a door the whole place shook. I didn鈥檛 like the fact that the only windows looked out onto the external corridor, so no privacy unless the curtains are closed. You can鈥檛 open the bathroom window without leaving yourself exposed. Not the nicest area to walk around especially at night, 10min walk to the Fishermans wharf area, a few v. steep blocks to the twisty part of Lombard street. The hiking boots I bought for visiting Yosemite came into use again. The gradient of the streets were worse than the trails in Yosemite.There is a very good Italian place next-door. Very small and without a liquor licence, but the food was very tasty. Bolognese with spinach and mushrooms. Other evenings we walked a couple of blocks to Polk Street where there are a number of good restaurants including thai noodle and rex鈥檚 diner. The hotel and room was fine as a base. We didn鈥檛 spend much time in the room anyway.
Reviews.Author: KC-belfast

Reviews.Content: It is what it is A cheap hotel in an expensive city. Kind of felt like we were getting ripped off but it was one of those convention weekends. Location wasn't awful but it wouldn't be my first pick for next time. Room was nice enough with all the usual amenities. The block was pretty quiet which after my last SF trip was a big bonus. Overall, good choice and excellent friendly staff that dont mind if you sleep past checkout :)
Reviews.Author: kaberck

Reviews.Content: Very good value; looked to be newly remodeled This hotel appeared to be newly remodeled and was very clean. It's probably more like a mile to the main Fisherman's Wharf area (Pier 39) than the six blocks listed on their website, but we love to walk and there's no better way to experience SF anyway. Not a lot of restaurants close, but take a walk 8 blocks south or so to Cow Town, where there are a lot of reasonably priced ones. Staff was friendly and helpful. The onsite parking was a bonus even if it was $12 a day, but that's the way it is when you stay in any major city so we certainly didn't mind. The only downside was that it is a little noisy because Lombard is such a busy street, but we were usually so tired at night that it was no problem falling asleep.
Reviews.Author: alholter

Reviews.Content: Good Budget Hotel We stayed here for 2 nights in October.It was good value for money, clean and tidy and the staff were very helpful. We were on ground floor and one night someone was above us and it was a bit noisy.Overall, I would stay there again - it was a budget hotel, but we knew that, and it was fine for what we wanted . If I was there more than a week, I would probably upgrade to another and pay a bit (lot?!) more.It was well situation for cafes and restaurants and close to a lot of places of interest.
Reviews.Author: ChrisNewZealand

Reviews.Content: Perfect After a very disappointing stay at the Travelodge in Santa Cruz, this was a breath of fresh air. Clean, safe location, close to many activities. Very nice staff. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking to stay at a budget motel in San Francisco.
Reviews.Author: Chamberman

Reviews.Content: Book on line Interesting bait and switch. Made reservation on-line but we didn't pay until we arrived. Surprise!! The $99 rate jumped to $139 per night. The rooms are REALLY OLD and dated, but quite spacious. Bathroom was tiny, but the vanity is located actually in the room with no wall to block it, so the room looks bigger than it is.Hallway leading to the room is grim - carpet is FILTHY and walls bear the marks of thousands of travelers' luggage, covered with baby-poo yellow paint.That said, its a perfectly fine flop-house to base your San Francisco trip from. The location couldn't be better - 10-minute walk to Ghirardelli Square; 20 minutes to Fisherman's Wharf; buses, trolleys, and cable cars are readily available (find out how to get a day-pass).Next time, tho, I'll Google some of the other Lombard Street hotels. At $99, the Travelodge is great - at $139...not so much.
Reviews.Author: AirplaneDoc

Reviews.Content: Excellent Location We have stayed at this hotel 3 times now on short visits to SF, and chose it predominently for its great location....its not 'on the bay' exactly, but its ony 10 minutes walk to Fishermans Wharf , and the area feels very safe. I would also recommend walking to Union Street, only around the corner, which has some great buildings, shopping areas and restaurants.The hotel is not the best i've stayed in by any means, but its clean, reasonably priced, and the staff have always been friendly to me.Beware though if you have a car, they charge $12 a night for parking.
Reviews.Author: backbeat_7

Reviews.Content: Great Location,Clean ,Safe Stayed here for 2 nights. My teenage daughter and I. Felt safe, great location, 2 blocks from Lombard crooked street just up the hill,Short driveing distance to Coit tower (must see at night) Palace of fine arts, park under golden gate and walk to the GG bridge and across. China town is short drive also. Room was BIG and clean, has a refrigerator,microwave, coffee maker, alarm clock,blow dryer. Shower was nice and hot,, lots of preasure. Parking was easy $12 per day at motel well worth it. Laundry matt on site for guest 7pm/10pm lots of restrants to walk to also. Check in was fast. I would suggest staying in a room on the third floor so no over head noise.
Reviews.Author: Diana7Michigan

Reviews.Content: Good for the money       View of our Patio
Reviews.Author: LePiaf

Reviews.Content: OK location, but....... Location was OK, but...... extra charge for parking of $15/day was not disclosed, and in lot parking was not available. Needed help to find another parking lot. The reservation was incorrect as well; I had asked for two beds and one one was available. Room was very small, not very clean, and the air conditioner did not work. They did take pets, and were a bit helpful in finding local restaurants. By the time I added on extra parking fees, and pet fees I was up to $135.00 per night. Could have stayed elsewhere for about the same money and a much better atmosphere. Best thing was the Presidio grounds close by for walking the dog.
Reviews.Author: onebabykitty

Reviews.Content: Great place and location It was so lovely that it was hard to leave to our next location.Each morning they have a little continental breakfast with coffee, tea and some cookies and cakes.The hotel is located on lombard street - Great location.There is a good place to eat near the hotel (2 min) which is also not expensive and clean.If we will come back to san francisco someday, we probably stay there again.
Reviews.Author: doribd

Reviews.Content: Great location This hotel is well located for fisherman's wharf which is within easy walking distance.The room was a good size for San Francisco, having a seperate bedroom.Cleanliness wasn't the best and the decor was a bit tired,Reception staff very helpful.
Reviews.Author: Mawdesley

Reviews.Content: Great location, room not so great! The Travelodge by the bay has an awesome location at Lombard and Van Ness. It is a block away from Muni bus stops that can take you to the wharves, Union Square and Chinatown.Our room was large and clean. The bed was uncomfortable, but not terribly so. My major complaint was the bathroom shower. To accomodate a window the shower head was placed under the window at a very low height. The water came out at an unnaturally low level causing a person to squat down to have the water hit where it should.The lobby is non-existant, there is just room for the front desk. Parking is very tight resulting in a lot of jockeying to get in and out.The staff was friendly and helpful.If you get a different room you may be satisfied with this motel.
Reviews.Author: rick390

Reviews.Content: Happy at Travelodge by the Bay We stayed at Travelodge by the Bay in San Francisco for two nights as part of a budget 3 week trip around California. We found the place to be great. Great rooms, clean and good size all for a good price (esp compared to other hotels in the same area!).Good location and walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and the of course the crookedest street in the world. Staff were helpful and friendly. Parking available at all times but cost extra. The only negative thing I can think of is that the breakfast was served in the tiny reception area so reception was always packed in the mornings with people trying to check out and also people collecting their danish and coffee.We would definately stay here again if we go back to San Francisco.
Reviews.Author: davo292

Reviews.Content: Great Location I stayed at the Travelodge by the Bay for 7 nights, I found the hotel represented very good value for the money I paid. The location of the Hotel is great, the Marina is a very cool place to be, totally safe and very friendly, transport, ie cable car and busses are 5 minutes away, 10 minutes to Fishermans Whart (if that is your thing). Lombard Union and Chestnut have great restaraunts, shops etc and if you require groceries there is a Safeway about 10 minutes walk away. Finally the staff are extremely friendly and helpful, I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Cheap but not great A bargain rate in an expensive city and you get what you pay for. A bit run down and scuzzy. But in a great location with on-site parking. If you don't mind the lack of luxury it's okay. But if you want a nice SF experience there are nicer places.
Reviews.Author: TheNewsGuy

Reviews.Content: Good location, poor room I had stayed at this hotel a long time ago, in 1998, when I first visited San Francisco. At that time, it seemed good, despite the noise and the smell from the restaurant below our window. This time, I decided to stay here again because it was affordable, and I would be alone, so I preferred to stay in a well known neighborhood... But I was so disappointed! I stayed again at the same block that has the entrance by the garage. The room was very old and not very clean... In the second night, I had to change to another room, because I found an enourmous bug in the bed, killed it and spread bug's blood all over the sheets... Yaks! And then, when I was drying my hair, the outlet almost burned down! At least, the service was kind and attentious... One guy helped me to solve a problem with my car rental, the other helped me to change rooms and fixed the hair dryer... But the facility needs a lot of improvement...
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Would recommend this (if you get the right sort of price) I booked this hotel online and therefore wasn't really sure of how the price of $89 (plus tax) per night compared with other hotels in SF (I'm not a local). Having stayed there, I'd probably rate it about a 2 and a half star - there aren't any frills but it's a good place to stay. So if you get the right price, I'd go for it.I had a queen bed in a huge room - one of the biggest hotel rooms I've been in. There was even a walk-in wardrobe (a small one)!The room had what I expected from a basic (without frills) hotel room - it was clean, the shower head was attached to the wall (as opposed to having to hold it yourself) and had good pressure, the bathroom was well set out (i.e the toilet didn't get wet while you had a shower), the bed was comfortable and the TV had a remote control. It gets extra points for the huge room - still can't get over how big the room was, for a hotel room anyway. Service at the front desk was very friendly and efficient.The only slight downside is that it's located in a quiet part of the city - still close enough to walk to the main sites (Fisherman's Wharf etc) and on very good bus routes - but not as close as some of the other (more expensive) hotels. So, if you don't want to walk for more than 10-15 minutes to get somewhere, this place isn't for you. If you decide to stay, there are some fantastic shops / restaurants located on Union St, about 15 minutes walk from the hotel. Would definitely recommend this hotel - but don't expect any frills.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A quick, simple stay       The Golden Gate Bridge steam pipe (from the room's window)
Reviews.Author: PinkFloyd2001

Reviews.Content: Godd value basic accomodation. Recommended.   showReview(3493555, 'full');
Reviews.Author: Harry_Blackmaskers

Reviews.Content: Cozy, friendly, and most importantly . . . sufficient!   showReview(3399111, 'full');
Reviews.Author: dove95

Reviews.Content: Very Satisfied   showReview(3340298, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Decent location, large rooms.   showReview(3161371, 'full');
Reviews.Author: icem2829

Reviews.Content: Very happy, and returned for a second visit   showReview(2806687, 'full');
Reviews.Author: elkiedee

Reviews.Content: What a dump   showReview(1782996, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Disgusted   showReview(1774699, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nice Location, not by the bay though!   showReview(1663321, 'full');
Reviews.Author: Fontane77

Reviews.Content: fully satisfied   showReview(1490833, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy but the location, price    showReview(1397932, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Un peu d茅莽us   showReview(19638562, 'full');

Reviews.Content: " h么tel agr茅able et bien situ茅"   showReview(19638561, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Hotel tr猫s abordable   showReview(18542493, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: Ottimo hotel   showReview(18150136, 'full');
Reviews.Author: 8-otto

Reviews.Content: preiswert und g眉nstig gelegen   showReview(15033668, 'full');
Reviews.Author: endlich-weg

Reviews.Content: Laut und es duftet nach Klostein und Frittenfett   showReview(10066334, 'full');
Reviews.Author: weihnaxmann12249

Reviews.Content: Tr猫s bruyant et vieille chambre   showReview(7988874, 'full');
Reviews.Author: Stilgar_Tabr

Reviews.Content: Bon rapport qualit茅 prix pour un s茅jour 脿 San Francisco   showReview(11429720, 'full');

Reviews.Content: superbe accueil   showReview(7012349, 'full');
Reviews.Author: misterzebra

Reviews.Content: Hotel sympathique, proche du centre touristique de SF   showReview(11334902, 'full');
